shortdesc.ph: Updates the spatial position of the local user.
Updates the spatial position of the local user.
Updates the local user's spatial position.
Updates the spatial position of the local user.

p.codeblock: Future<void> updateSelfPosition( {required List<double> position, required List<double> axisForward, required List<double> axisRight, required List<double> axisUp});
public abstract int UpdateSelfPosition(float[] position, float[] axisForward, float[] axisRight, float[] axisUp);

ul.li: Under the class, this method must be used together with . The SDK calculates the relative position between the local and remote users based on the parameters set in this method and , and then calculates the spatial audio parameters.

Under the class, this method must be used together with . The SDK calculates the relative position between the local and remote users based on the parameters set by this method and , and then calculates the spatial audio parameters.

Under the class, this method must be used together with . The SDK calculates the relative position between the local and remote users based on the parameters set by this method and , and then calculates the spatial audio parameters.

plentry.pd: Coordinates in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing the forward, right, and up coordinates, respectively.
Unit vector of the forward axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing the forward, right, and up coordinates, respectively.
Unit vector of the right axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing the forward, right, and up coordinates, respectively.
Unit vector of the up axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, with the three values representing the forward, right, and up coordinates, respectively.
Coordinates in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the forward, right, and up coordinate values respectively.
Unit vector of the forward axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the forward, right, and up coordinate values respectively.
Unit vector of the right axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the forward, right, and up coordinate values respectively.
Unit vector of the up axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the forward, right, and up coordinate values respectively.
Coordinates in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Unit vector of the forward axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Unit vector of the right axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Unit vector of the up axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.

Coordinates in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions, respectively. Forward, right, and up correspond to the positive directions of Unity's Vector3 z, x, and y axes.

Unit vector of the forward axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions, respectively. Forward, right, and up correspond to the positive directions of Unity's Vector3 z, x, and y axes.
Unit vector of the right axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Unit vector of the up axis in the world coordinate system. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting.
